comment: I found the class to be easy and actually more interesting than I expected. I did have to reach out to the TA mid semester, but she was very accommodating and easy to talk to. Would definitely take the class again.

Fowler is a great professor who actually cares about her students. She's knowledgeable and presents materials in a way that makes it easy to understand. She ensures students learns and not just memorize course content. She's a great teacher and should teach more classes in the department. Class attendance and reading prior to class is a must!
This class is super easy, the professor just never answers her emails. Pretty easy A though. Theres two exams, one essay, and short discussion posts throughout the semester
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Fowler is pretty awesome. Took her interviewing skills class and really enjoyed it. It was a super relaxed atmosphere and I got a lot out of it. She made the content interesting and gave many, many real world examples. She'll do whatever she can to work with you to get the grade you want and isn't too strict when it comes to deadlines.
Professor Fowler is a great teacher.  I wouldnt say it's an easy A, but if you do the work then you will make one.  Make sure you have tough skin if you plan on being part of the discussion.
READ! She will know if you haven't. Attendance is a must!

Make sure you read and she will know if you haven't. She's not for the meek at heart. She has a lot of field experiences that she brings into the classroom. She needs to be a fulltime professor as she has so much to offer KSU. They are fortunate to have Professor Fowler. She knows her stuff and wants her student to get everything they can from her.

Prof. Fowler is highly recommended. She is an AWESOME teacher. She expects students to read the chapters before class to participate in class discussions. She has been one of the Best Professor's I have had. She loves her career and brings real life experiences to class. You will definitely learn in her class. You will not be disappointed.

Dr. Fowler is great! She challenges the class and expects us to read, as a professor should. She has a lot of experience and gives examples if things are unclear. It is necessary to keep up with the reading, and if you do not she can tell. She likes for her students to be engaged. Some assignments seem vague at first but she always clarifies
